page.title: 17RELIGION IN HOLMES CHAPEL 1
page.content: There are three churches each of them follow the Christian faith. {St. Luke's}is Church of England. It is in the centre of the village and is the oldest building. A gallery was built in 1705 by Thomas Hall. The church holds 260 people. The largest stain glass window was put in about 1925 as a war memorial. Woodworm is a great problem. No one has been buried in the churchyard this century. There are seven bells in the tower but only six are used. They are all keyed in to F#. There is an organ. The vicar enjoys his work and has been doing his job for 34 years. Every Sunday about Â£220 is collected. A new church hall is being built. It is costing Â£86,000. Services on Sunday are: Communion, Sunday School, Matins and Evensong. During the week: Prayer meetings, Bible studies, etc.
